Patent Information.Abstract: A novel class of cationic peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Examples of such peptides include NH2-KWKSFIKKLTTAVKKVLTTGLPALIS-COOH (SEQ ID NO: 1) and NH2-KWKSFIKKLTSAAKKVVTTAKPLISS-COOH (SEQ ID NO: 2). Also provided are methods for inhibiting the growth of bacteria utilizing the peptides of the invention. The peptides are particularly useful for inhibiting endotoxemia in a subject.

A novel class of cationic peptides having antimicrobial activity is provided. Examples of such peptides include NH2KWKSFIKKLTTAVKKVLTTGLPALISCOOH (SEQ ID NO,1) and NH2KWKSFIKKLTSAAKKVVTTAKPLISSCOOH (SEQ ID NO23). Also provided are methods for inhibiti the growth of bacteria utilizing the peptides of the invention. The peptides are particularly useful for inhibiting endotoxemia in a subject.

Sequence Information.Family: Derived from the peptide CP26, CP29, CEME and CEMA
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=8 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa H744 (MIC=16 μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa H374 (MIC=8 μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry

Literature.Title: Biological properties of structurally related alpha-helical cationic antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: Scott MG, Yan H, Hancock RE.
